author: jochembrouwer
content:
Thanks for this write up. Has there also been some research done by anyone about the community response of EOF? Especially the removal of gas introspection (in particular how much gas we can forward to the next call) is something which some developers might dislike.
And a second side-question, if we have EOF we still have legacy EVM. Via EOF -> Legacy EXTCALL we can still make use of "banned" things like just reading the gas opcode. At some point we would likely want to get rid of "legacy EVM" because it has deprecated opcodes (selfdestruct and callcode), are there any thoughts on this yet? Is it even feasible/practical to do?

author: jochembrouwer
content: I see some minor changes being made to EOF EIPs (which is fine) but I also see some "additions" to EOF in Proposed for Inclusion e.g. https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-7880, which raises the question is the spec for EOF done, does it need minor changes, or does it get extra EIPs in it?

author: jochembrouwer
content: We also have the point regarding all gas being forwarded in EOF CALLs so the solidity `send()` `reentrant()` (or something like that which sends 0 gas so practically 2300) protects against re-entrancy, but in EOF currently scheduled for Fusaka this is not possible (all gas is forwarded). PAY should then be included. https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-5920 And the additional benefits for PAY for smart contract developers not having to think about "what if I have to pay a smart contract instead of EOA" is also super helpful.
